definition: to pass on to sb/to carry and give to sb else
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: The visa application charge will be returned to the applicant, care of the migration agent's address.
sentences.chinese: 签证申请费将会经由移民代理的地址转交退给申请人。

sentences.english: David Smith, care of Mary Jones, 16, High Street.
sentences.chinese: 高街16号玛丽琼斯转交戴维史密斯。

sentences.english: You letter of 15th August addressed to our Head Office has been passed on to us for attention and reply.
sentences.chinese: 您八月十五日致我总公司的信函已转交到我处作复。

sentences.english: If the House votes for impeachment, the case then goes to the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 弹劾案在众议院通过后即转交参议院审理。

sentences.english: I agree that the above data will be released to the manager of the church and the church.
sentences.chinese: 本人同意上述个人资料会转交予经理及教堂。

sentences.english: Dai Bingguo forwarded a letter for President Chirac by President Hu Jintao.
sentences.chinese: 戴秉国转交了胡锦涛主席致希拉克总统的信。

sentences.english: Venne presented gifts to Obama for his children and wife.
sentences.chinese: 维尼请他转交礼物给欧巴马的太太与小孩。

sentences.english: The bounteous largess given thee to give?
sentences.chinese: 慷慨的赏赐，却不予转交？

sentences.english: When you write to me from Kweilin, please address letter in care of my office above - Mrs.
sentences.chinese: 从桂林给我写信时，请寄我的办公室转交。

sentences.english: I would stick with A Sand County Almanac, and pass on Hands-On Environmentalism.
sentences.chinese: 我将继续支持一本沙县年鉴，并且转交实践的环境论。

sentences.english: I wrote to him care of Comrade Li.
sentences.chinese: 我写给他的信由李同志转交。

sentences.english: However, they do not transfer these chloroplasts to the next generations.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他们不转交这些叶绿体下一代。

sentences.english: He told me to send his letters on to his new address when he moved.
sentences.chinese: 他搬家时告诉我，把他的信转交到他的新地址去。

sentences.english: PiaoXianXiu left a letter, a grandma helped him over the east.
sentences.chinese: 朴贤秀留下一封信，托一位奶奶帮他转交恩东。

sentences.english: Acting in accordance with its methods of work, the Working Group forwarded to the Government the above-mentioned communication.
sentences.chinese: 工作组遵循其工作方法，向该国政府转交了上述来文。

sentences.english: Do not use a P. O. box or in-care-of address.
sentences.chinese: 不要使用邮政信箱或转交地址。

definition: to pass (sth) on (to sb else)/to transfer sb (to another hospital etc)
to hold in safekeeping/to have in one's care/to guarantee/certainly/surely/custodian/curator
to return/to give back/to send back/to repatriate
to forward (a message, letter, article etc)
